intro: Lipochaeta lobata var. albescens, commonly known as the white-flowered lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and often branched. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive floral display.
